item.title: Proof for height of a binary tree
item.description: I keep forgetting the standard result of the height of a binary tree. I figured, writing out the proof on my own might help me remember the result. We assume that the tree is a full binary tree for simplicity. A full binary tree is defined as follows[1]: A binary tree in which each node has exactly zero or two children. A binary tree starts with the root node at level one(we consider levels to be 1-indexed).
